str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To clean (cleanse) out, clean thoroughly. From ek and kathairo; to cleanse thoroughly.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Himself, herself, itself.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A vessel, implement, equipment or apparatus (specially, a wife as contributing to the usefulness of the husband).
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
A price, honor. From tino; a value, i.e. Money paid, or valuables; by analogy, esteem, or the dignity itself.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: From hagios; to make holy, i.e. purify or consecrate; to venerate.
Useful, serviceable, very profitable. From eu and chrestos; easily used, i.e. Useful.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A lord, master, or prince. Perhaps from deo and posis; an absolute ruler.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: To make ready, prepare. From hetoimos; to prepare.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A primary word; 'good'.
From a primary ergo; toil; by implication, an act.
